timeline.message: Finished implementation. Need to start tests

timeline.bodyText: I think our pattern for these are to add what resource it applies to at the beginning. So I think the options for this PR should be prefixed with Path
timeline.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: Can we make this something like Recursively sets access control on a path and its subpaths, and so on? Right now it could read as just 2 levels
timeline.author: gapra-msft

timeline.bodyText: Should we do the try catch error thing here so we can log it?
timeline.author: gapra-msft
timeline.diffHunk:

For more information, see the + * Azure Docs

Code Samples

replies.bodyText: Yea idk why we don't do it on all the datalake methods. I'll add it to all the other ones, too
replies.author: rickle-msft

replies.bodyText: Hmm. Looks like we don't do that for any of the methods in BlobClientBase either, so I think it'd be better to do that as a separate PR
replies.author: rickle-msft

timeline.bodyText: operation continues till end or error

replies.bodyText: Yea. And I think I need to add null checks to the internal implementation method, too

timeline.bodyText: This sounds kinda weird. Do we have other examples of this? It feels more normal to call this setIsDirectory
timeline.author: gapra-msft

replies.bodyText: I agree. But can we do setIsDirectory and isDirectory. I'm not sure if the guidelines ok with there being an extra "is" in the setter.
replies.author: rickle-msft

timeline.bodyText: Same as with the isDirectory, this probably sounds better as setIsDefaultScope?
